A contraction mapping has at most onefixed point (mathematics)fixed point. Moreover, theBanach fixed point theoremstates that every contraction mapping on a nonemptycomplete metric spacehas a unique fixed point, and that for anyxinMtheiterated functionsequencex,f(x),f(f(x)),f(f(f(x))), ... converges to the fixed point. This concept is very useful foriterated function systemswhere contraction mappings are often used.
